alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Forsyth, northern Gwinnett, southern Hall and northeastern Fulton Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Milton, or 7 miles northeast of Mountain Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Lawrenceville, Cumming, Peachtree Corners, Mountain Park, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Milton, Duluth, Sugar Hill, Suwanee, Buford, Braselton, Auburn, Flowery Branch, Dacula, Oakwood, Berkeley Lake, and Rest Haven. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central Georgia.
